intro: Uncinia flaccida, commonly known as the drooping hookweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and often aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, creeping stems that produce small, pale yellow to white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Uncinia flaccida is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
